org.gradoop.storage.common.api

Interface EPGMGraphInput

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AccumuloEPGMStore, HBaseEPGMStore

    public interface EPGMGraphInput
extends Closeable
    Definition of graph store input. A graph input instance provide a set of writing methods for EPGM elements.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flush()
      Flushes all buffered writes to the store.
      void setAutoFlush(boolean autoFlush)
      Setting this value to true, forces the store implementation to flush the write buffers after every write.
      void writeEdge(EPGMEdge edgeData)
      Writes the given edge data into the graph store.
      void writeGraphHead(EPGMGraphHead graphData)
      Writes the given graph data into the graph store.
      void writeVertex(EPGMVertex vertexData)
      Writes the given vertex data into the graph store.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • writeGraphHead

        void writeGraphHead(@Nonnull
                    EPGMGraphHead graphData)
             throws IOException
        Writes the given graph data into the graph store.
        Parameters:
        graphData - graph data to write
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing the EPGMGraphHead fails

        Writes the given vertex data into the graph store.

      • setAutoFlush

        void setAutoFlush(boolean autoFlush)
        Setting this value to true, forces the store implementation to flush the write buffers after every write.
        Parameters:
        autoFlush - true to enable auto flush, false to disable

      • flush

        void flush()
    throws IOException
        Flushes all buffered writes to the store.
        Throws:
        IOException - if flushing changes to the store fails
